importantArticles.headline: On today's Market Minute, Julie Hyman provides a quick overview of the trending stories investors need to know about. Tesla (TSLA) is rising, making up for earlier losses fueled by first quarter deliveries missing estimates, on reports that President Donald Trump CEO Elon Musk will step back from his role in US politics. Rivian (RIVN) reports a sales decline in first quarter deliveries. Rocket (RKT) shares gain on several analyst upgrades. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
importantArticles.title: Tesla & Elon Musk, Rivian, Rocket: Market Minute

importantArticles.title: Why Mr. Cooper Group Inc. (COOP) Went Up On Monday?

importantArticles.headline: Shares of the mortgage-servicing company Mr. Cooper Group (NASDAQ: COOP) had blasted 16.3% higher at 10:38 a.m. ET, after the company announced that it had agreed to be acquired by the mortgage giant Rocket Companies.  Rocket plans to buy Mr. Cooper Group in an all-stock deal that values the company at $9.4 billion, or $143.33 per share.  Mr. Cooper Group's chairman and CEO, Jay Bray, will become chairman and CEO of Rocket Mortgage upon the deal's closing, and two members of Mr. Cooper Group will join the company's board.
importantArticles.title: Why Shares of Mr. Cooper Group Are Blasting Higher Today

importantArticles.headline: Shares of the mortgage giant Rocket Companies (NYSE: RKT) were trading about 8% lower at 11:48 a.m. ET today, after the company announced plans to acquire the large mortgage servicing company Mr. Cooper Group.  It's clear that Rocket is trying to consolidate and gain market share amid a challenging high-interest-rate environment that has now dogged the mortgage sector for the last few years.  A few weeks ago, Rocket announced that it would acquire Redfin in a $1.75 billion deal.
importantArticles.title: Why Shares of Rocket Companies Are Falling After a Big Acquisition Announcement

importantArticles.headline: Rocket Companies (RKT) is expanding its business by acquiring Mr. Cooper (COOP) for $9.4 billion to build a homeownership platform that integrates everything from home search to servicing. Rocket Companies CEO Varun Krishna joins Wealth host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to explain that this acquisition will enhance their client relationships and improve profitability. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.
importantArticles.title: Why Rocket Companies is betting big on Mr. Cooper
